feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a payroll system feature that automatically computes and deducts daily pay rates when employees take unpaid leave. It calculates daily pay by dividing the employee's total salary (basic + allowance) by the number of actual working or calendar days in the month, accounting for public holidays. The feature automatically generates pay deductions reflected on the payroll table upon approval of unpaid leave requests. It supports both calendar day-based and working day-based leave policies, with public holidays automatically subtracted from the working day count. This ensures accurate salary deductions aligned with the organization's leave policy framework.

source_articles_index.title: How is daily pay calculated
source_articles_index.article_summary: Explains how daily pay is calculated for unpaid leave deductions. Daily pay is computed by dividing total salary (basic + allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculation accounts for leave policy type (calendar or working days) and automatically deducts public holidays from the working day count. Upon unpaid leave approval, the system automatically creates and reflects the pay deduction on the payroll table.

source_articles_index.title: Introduction to daily wage calculator
source_articles_index.article_summary: Introduces the Daily Wage Calculator feature, explaining its purpose to provide flexible and customizable daily wage calculation methods. Describes three calculation base options (calendar days, working days, custom days), salary component selection capabilities, and the feature's impact on salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions. Includes definitions of each calculation base and notes regional labor law compliance considerations for UAE and KSA companies.

source_articles_index.title: Salary Proration
source_articles_index.article_summary: This article explains how Super admins can update salary proration in the Daily Wage Calculator by selecting calculation bases (custom days, calendar days, or working days) through Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. Changes affect all active unpaid payroll amounts. When payroll month is open with submitted prorated transactions, Super admin must reject existing transactions before saving new proration settings.

procedures.procedure_name: Calculate Daily Pay for Unpaid Leave Deduction
procedures.when_to_use: When an unpaid leave request is approved and a salary deduction needs to be calculated and applied.
steps: Receive and approve the unpaid leave request
Identify the organization's leave policy (calendar days or working days)
Determine the total number of days in the policy (e.g., 30 calendar days or 22 working days)
Identify all public holidays falling within the calculation month
Subtract public holidays from the working days count to obtain actual working days
Obtain the employee's total salary amount (Basic + Allowance)
Apply the formula: Daily Pay = Salary Amount / Actual Working Days
Automatically create and reflect the pay deduction on the payroll table

procedures.when_to_use: When setting up or modifying daily wage calculation methodology for payroll processing.
steps: Select calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days)
Choose salary components to include in calculation

procedures.when_to_use: When Super admin needs to change how employee salaries are prorated based on days worked
steps: Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation
Select the required calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days
If payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted, reject the existing transactions with prorated salaries
Save the changes for salary proration again to apply new settings

rules_limitations_constraints.rule: Daily pay is calculated using the formula: Daily Pay = Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) / Number of actual working days in the month. ; The leave policy determines whether calculations use calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 working days). ; Public holidays falling in the month for which daily pay is being calculated must be deducted from the working days to arrive at actual working days. ; Only approved unpaid leave requests trigger automatic pay deduction creation.

Calendar days calculation uses the actual number of days in each month (31 days in January, 28 days in February, etc.). Working days calculation excludes weekends and public holidays as defined in company's public holiday calendar. Custom days allows companies to set a fixed number of days (commonly 30 days for UAE and KSA compliance with labor law requirements).

Changes to salary proration will have an effect on all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table immediately upon saving. ; When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, the Super admin must reject the transactions with prorated salaries before saving new proration changes.

edge_cases_warnings.edge_case_or_warning: When public holidays fall within the calculation month, they must be explicitly subtracted from the working days count. For example, if 2 days are public holidays and the policy is 22 working days, the calculation uses 20 days instead of 22. ; The number of days used in the denominator differs based on leave policy: calendar day policies use fixed calendar days (e.g., 30), while working day policies use the specified working days minus public holidays.

Daily wage calculations vary based on month length when using calendar days method (e.g., 31 days in January versus 28 days in February), which directly impacts salary proration and leave encashment amounts. Selection of different calculation bases can significantly affect final wage calculations and must align with company policy and regional labor law requirements.
If the payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, Super admin must manually reject those transactions and then resave the proration settings to apply the new calculation basis.

Daily Wage Calculator interacts with Payroll settings, public holiday calendar configuration, salary proration calculations, leave encashment processes, and unpaid leave deduction systems to ensure consistent and accurate wage calculations across all payroll functions.
